page.title: 12Cromwell and Norwell's Vicar
page.content: {Rev. James}has been a vicar since 1952, after being a pilot in the R.A.F. during World War Two. His parish covers the villages of{Norwell} and{Cromwell}in our block. Sunday is a very busy day for him as it will involve morning, afternoon and evening services at sometimes Norwell, Cromwell and Ossington. This would have been impossible in the pre motor car age. No two weekdays are alike for the vicar. He likes to spend his mornings reading the newspaper, in quiet prayer and reading a chapter or two of the {Good News Bible.}He has people ring him for advice and is often asked to help fill in official forms. He enjoys walking around the village with his dog and visiting his parishioners. He visits our school every Thursday and takes{assembly. }
